intro: Oxydectes chlorocalyx, commonly known as the white-flowered oxydectes, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are ovate with a smooth surface and a waxy texture. Oxydectes chlorocalyx thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
